result.execSummary:
The defendant David P. Bronk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs.   25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

supervisions.notes: (amended 10 yrs ES down to 5 yrs ES per Judge)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay costs.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Conditions are the same as 15CF25 Extended Supervision conditions.

Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are: 15CF25 & 14CF91

9:27 am. Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Corrections made on the record.
Atty Knaapen argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney Hughes argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes statement.

BY THE COURT:
15CF25 
Ct 1: 940.06(1) 
Determinate sentence of 15 years prison
5 years initial, 10 years extended supervision

Conditions
No contact with the family of Ethan Eckerson.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Complete an AODA Assessment and comply with recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign release of info forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.
Provide agent with list of all medications that the offender is prescribed.
All prescription medications must come from one pharmacy.
Pay costs
Provide DNA sample
Pay DNA surcharge
No contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal drugs.

482 days jail credit


14CF91
Ct 1: 961.41(1)(a)
Determinate sentence of 15 years prison concurrent with 15CF25
5 years initial, 10 years extended 
Conditions are same as 15CF25
Same jail credit
Pay costs


Ct 3: 961.41(1m)9a)
Sentence withheld, 7 years probation concurrent with other sentences
Conditions are same as extended supervision


Ct 6: 961.42(1)
Determinate sentence of 3 yr 6 mos prison concurrent with Ct 1 and 15CF25
1 yr 6 mos initial, 2 years extended concurrent 
Same credit as 15CF25
Pay costs

Defendant has the right to appeal.

Atty Hughes makes statement in regards to indigency.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders that there is no reimbursement by the Defendant.
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's department.

Atty Knaapen questions in regards to defendants eligibility for incarceration program.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is not eligible for challenge incarceration program but is eligible for substance abuse program.

Plea hearing at 04-23-2015 08:30 am
Defendant's Affidavit in Support of Defendant's Motion to Dismiss

10:37 a.m. Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs that there is a Reserve Judge, Judge Miller, has been assigned for the Jury Trial dates.  Parties will address the motions today.
States Motion for Joinder is addressed.
Atty Hughes states the State's Motion is not in proper form and requests it to be denied. Atty Hughes states reasons for Motion for Joinder to be denied.
ADA Knaapen makes further statements in support of the Motion for Joinder.
Atty Hughes makes further statements in support of the denying the motion.
Court reviews transcripts of the files.
BY THE COURT: Motion for Joinder is Granted and the two cases may be tried together.
---------
Defense's Motion to Dismiss 14CF91: delay of speedy trial rights:
Atty Hughes makes statements in support of the Motion to Dismiss.
ADA Knaapen makes statements opposing the Motion to Dismiss.
Atty Hughes makes further statements in support of the motion.
ADA Knaapen makes further statements opposing the motion - valid reason for appropriate delay.
Court reviews files dates and time history.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to Dismiss 14CF91 is denied.
_____
Defense's Motion for 3rd Party Evidence:
ADA Knaapen makes statements opposing the motion. Strick liability case type not motive type.
Atty Hughes makes statements in support of the motion. Motive type case.
BY THE COURT: Motion for 3rd Party Evidence be allowed - Granted.
____
Defense's Motion for Prior Convictions - Granted
____
Defense's Motion to Compel Discovery: 
Atty Hughes states maybe some recordings he should be entitled to.
ADA Knaapen will look into it and will provide if available.
___
Atty Hughes to inform the Court before 4:30 p.m. 04-22-15 if need to cancel and/or reschedule jury trial.

11:40 a.m.Court in recess.
to Dismiss

for Joinder - for trial
Motion hearing on April 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.
for Continuance
Jury trial - 12 person on April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Hughes in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is incarcerated, is not present at this hearing.

12:06 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, hands to Court a note summarizing a telephone conversation from Friday.

Atty Knaapen requests a continuance for the jury trial tomorrow.

Atty Hughes addresses the Court, objects to the continuance of the jury trial.

Court addresses the parties. 

BY THE COURT:
Court feels there is no need to try the case twice. The two charges could have been put in one complaint. The Court has another trial for tomorrow.
Court will grant the continuance but order that this file 14CF-91 be set for jury trial April 23rd. Court asks the parties to do what they could to try to set the new case 15CF-25,  for the same Jury Trial date.

Atty Hughes is requesting a speedy trial.

of Bond Hearing on 02-13-14
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Michael D. Hughes. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:25 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

This is a motion to modify bond filed by Defense.

Atty Hughes addresses the Court regarding motion.
There has not been a homicide charge. There should be a bond but a cash bond of $25,000 should be amended to $1,000 cash, for reasons stated on the record.
Defendant is not a flight risk.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding bond modification. Defendant is looking at a 45 year imprisonment just on the first three counts. 
Homicide case has not been charged but referrals have been filed with the DA's office from the Sheriff's Department. 
State hopes in the near future to get the homicide charge out. 

Atty Hughes addresses the Court, requests to be heard further.

Court reviews the charges. Defendant has previous criminal history. Defendant has numerous felony charges. 

Court states the bond previously set was appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Motion is denied.
Court will not modify the bond at this time.
Bond is ordered continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on August 4, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Atty Hughes

Defendant David P. Bronk in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant David P. Bronk in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances. 

Court reviews the file.  This hearing is a result of ex-parte statement from the defendant. 
Defendant would like to dismiss his attorney at this time. 
Atty Raabe makes statements to the Court.  Was waiting for discovery in the case which is why he had no conversations with the defendant.  Once he received discovery, he found he had a conflict and had to withdraw. 

Court questions defendant. 
Atty Raabe was appointed by the Court.
Court will keep the 6/30 pretrial date.  
BY THE COURT: Court grants the request and will contact another attorney.  Court will notify the defendant and the jail of who the new attorney is.
granted /s/JVF Atty Raabe

Defendant David P. Bronk appeared by video. 
Court swears in the defendant.  Questions the defendant regarding his petition for appointment of counsel. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds the defendant indigent at this time. 
Court will review at the end of the case.  Advises defendant he may have to reimburse the County for the cost of the attorney at the end of the case. 
Atty Eric Sheets is present in the Courtroom. 
Atty Sheets indicates he has a conflict. 
Atty Adam Raabe is present in the Court. 
Atty Raabe doesn't believe he will have a conflict. 
Court advises Atty Raabe that the defendant's initial appearance is on Monday.  
Atty Raabe accepts the case.  He will see the defendant at the jail today. Attorney Adam Raabe in court.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David P. Bronk appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David Raymond Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant has not seen an attorney.  He has been in jail for a month.  No attorney has talked to him at all. 
Court directs the Public Defender to see him in the jail to see if he qualifies. 

*Atty Knaapen indicates bond was previously set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  Do not provide anyone else with his controlled substances except with his wife so she can keep track of Defendant taking them as prescribed. Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Ethan Eckerson Family. No contact with Michelle Wrzinski.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

Defendant does not understand a lot of this, Defendant admitted to giving Mr. Eckerson 2 pills, not enough to die from or kill himself.

Court questions the defendant.
